intro: Tibetiodes bulleyana, commonly known as the Tibetan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in summer. The plant features broad, palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
